trans-unit.source: Represents a container for bitmap frames.
Each bitmap frame is a <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Imaging.BitmapSource"></xref>.
This abstract class provides a base set of functionality for all derived decoder objects.
BitmapDecoder is not a <xref:System.Windows.Media.Imaging.BitmapFrame> itself; rather, it is a container for <xref:System.Windows.Media.Imaging.BitmapFrame> objects.
Each <xref:System.Windows.Media.Imaging.BitmapFrame> in the container can potentially have different attributes, including different sizes, resolutions, or palettes.

Unless a specific codec is selected, [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_winclient](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md)] uses automatic run-time discovery to identify the format of an image and match it with the appropriate codec.
This discovery process allows a codec developed by an [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_isv](~/add/includes/tlasharptla-isv-md.md)] to be automatically discoverable by the system.
To select a specific codec, the derived BitmapDecoder or <xref:System.Windows.Media.Imaging.BitmapEncoder>, such as the <xref:System.Windows.Media.Imaging.TiffBitmapDecoder> class, should be used.
[!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_tiff](~/add/includes/tlasharptla-tiff-md.md)] and [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_gif](~/add/includes/tlasharptla-gif-md.md)] are the only implemented image formats that support multiple frames.
Initializes a new instance of <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Imaging.BitmapDecoder"></xref>.
Gets information that describes this codec.
A <xref:System.Windows.Media.Imaging.BitmapCodecInfo> implementation is required for every codec.
An instance of <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Imaging.BitmapCodecInfo"></xref>.
This property has no default value.
Gets a value that represents the color profile associated with a bitmap, if one is defined.
An instance of <xref href="System.Windows.Media.ColorContext"></xref> that represents the embedded color profile of the bitmap.
If no color profile has been defined, this property returns <xref uid="langword_csharp_null" name="null" href=""></xref>.
This property has no default value.

Creates a <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Imaging.BitmapDecoder"></xref> from a <xref:System.IO.Stream> by using the specified <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Imaging.BitmapCreateOptions"></xref> and <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Imaging.BitmapCacheOption"></xref>.
Use the <xref:System.Windows.Media.Imaging.BitmapCacheOption> cache option if you wish to close the `bitmapStream` after the decoder is created.
The default <xref:System.Windows.Media.Imaging.BitmapCacheOption> cache option retains access to the stream until the bitmap is needed, and cleanup is handled by the garbage collector.
The file stream that identifies the bitmap to decode.
Identifies the <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Imaging.BitmapCreateOptions"></xref> for this decoder.
Identifies the <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Imaging.BitmapCacheOption"></xref> for this decoder.

A <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Imaging.BitmapDecoder"></xref> from a <xref:System.IO.Stream> by using the specified <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Imaging.BitmapCreateOptions"></xref> and <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Imaging.BitmapCacheOption"></xref>.

Creates a <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Imaging.BitmapDecoder"></xref> from a <xref:System.Uri> by using the specified <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Imaging.BitmapCreateOptions"></xref> and <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Imaging.BitmapCacheOption"></xref>.
The <xref:System.Uri> of the bitmap to decode.
Identifies the <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Imaging.BitmapCreateOptions"></xref> for this decoder.
Identifies the <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Imaging.BitmapCacheOption"></xref> for this decoder.

A <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Imaging.BitmapDecoder"></xref> from a <xref:System.Uri> by using the specified <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Imaging.BitmapCreateOptions"></xref> and <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Imaging.BitmapCacheOption"></xref>.
The bitmapUri is .
The bitmapUri specifies a class ID of an unsupported format type.

Creates a <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Imaging.BitmapDecoder"></xref> from a <xref:System.Uri> by using the specified <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Imaging.BitmapCreateOptions"></xref>, <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Imaging.BitmapCacheOption"></xref> and <xref href="System.Net.Cache.RequestCachePolicy"></xref>.
Create is introduced in the .NET Framework version 3.5.
The location of the bitmap from which the <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Imaging.BitmapDecoder"></xref> is created.
The options that are used to create this <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Imaging.BitmapDecoder"></xref>.
The cache option that is used to create this <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Imaging.BitmapDecoder"></xref>.
The caching requirements for this <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Imaging.BitmapDecoder"></xref>.

A <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Imaging.BitmapDecoder"></xref> from a <xref:System.Uri> by using the specified <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Imaging.BitmapCreateOptions"></xref>, <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Imaging.BitmapCacheOption"></xref> and <xref href="System.Net.Cache.RequestCachePolicy"></xref>.
Creates an instance of <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Imaging.InPlaceBitmapMetadataWriter"></xref>, which can be used to update the metadata of a bitmap.
An instance of <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Imaging.InPlaceBitmapMetadataWriter"></xref>.
The file original image stream is read only.
The decoder is not a built in decoder.
Occurs when a <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Imaging.BitmapDecoder"></xref> has finished downloading bitmap content.
This event may not be raised for all types of bitmap content.
To be added.
Occurs when bitmap content failed to download.
To be added.
Occurs when a <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Imaging.BitmapDecoder"></xref> has made progress downloading bitmap content.
To be added.
Frees resources and performs other cleanup operations before the <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Imaging.BitmapDecoder"></xref> is reclaimed by garbage collection.
This method overrides <xref:System.Object.Finalize%2A>.

Application code should not call this method; an object's `Finalize` method is automatically invoked during garbage collection, unless finalization by the garbage collector has been disabled by a call to the <xref:System.GC.SuppressFinalize%2A> method.

For more information, see [Finalize Methods and Destructors](http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/fd376774-1643-499b-869e-9546a3aeea70), [Cleaning Up Unmanaged Resources](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md), and [Overriding the Finalize Method](http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/8026cb68-fe93-43fc-96c1-c09ad7d64cd3).
Gets the content of an individual frame within a bitmap.
Only [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_tiff](~/add/includes/tlasharptla-tiff-md.md)] and [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_gif](~/add/includes/tlasharptla-gif-md.md)] images support more than one frame.
Any <xref:System.Windows.Media.Imaging.BitmapFrame> objects returned by this property are frozen.
An instance of <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Imaging.BitmapFrame"></xref>.
This property has no default value.
Gets a value that indicates if the decoder is currently downloading content.
<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> if the decoder is downloading content; otherwise, <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
Gets an instance of <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Imaging.BitmapMetadata"></xref> that represents the global metadata associated with this bitmap, if metadata is defined.
None of the built-in derived <xref:System.Windows.Media.Imaging.BitmapDecoder> classes support global metadata.
Metadata should be added to the individual frames of an image.
An instance of <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Imaging.BitmapMetadata"></xref> that represents global metadata associated with a bitmap.
If no metadata is defined, this property returns <xref uid="langword_csharp_null" name="null" href=""></xref>.
Gets the <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Imaging.BitmapPalette"></xref> associated with this decoder.
The <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Imaging.BitmapPalette"></xref> associated with this decoder.
If the bitmap has no palette, <xref uid="langword_csharp_null" name="null" href=""></xref> is returned.
This property has no default value.
Gets a <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Imaging.BitmapSource"></xref> that represents the global preview of this bitmap, if one is defined.
The <xref:System.Windows.Media.Imaging.BitmapSource> returned by this property is frozen.
A <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Imaging.BitmapSource"></xref> that represents the global preview of the bitmap.
If no preview is defined, this property returns <xref uid="langword_csharp_null" name="null" href=""></xref>.
This property has no default value.
Gets a <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Imaging.BitmapSource"></xref> that represents the thumbnail of the bitmap, if one is defined.
None of the native formats support global thumbnails.

[!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_jpegorg](~/add/includes/tlasharptla-jpegorg-md.md)], [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_tiff](~/add/includes/tlasharptla-tiff-md.md)], and [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_wdp](~/add/includes/tlasharptla-wdp-md.md)] support frame-level thumbnails that can be accessed using the <xref:System.Windows.Media.Imaging.BitmapFrame.Thumbnail%2A> property.
The <xref:System.Windows.Media.Imaging.BitmapSource> returned by this property is frozen.
A <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Imaging.BitmapSource"></xref> that represents a thumbnail of the bitmap.
If no thumbnail is defined, this property returns <xref uid="langword_csharp_null" name="null" href=""></xref>.
This property has no default value.
Converts the current value of a <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Imaging.BitmapDecoder"></xref> to a <xref:System.String>.
A string representation of the <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Imaging.BitmapDecoder"></xref>.
